supporting_spans: Kai-Koumou trembled with rage and his countenance was flushed with a fierce exultation.
Glenarvan hesitated, and watched the Maori chief very attentively.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character Kai-Koumou does not take bones from his comrades as tokens and does not swear to shield the survivors after a skirmish at a British outpost.

analysis.claim_text: In a skirmish at a British outpost friendly fire killed several of his comrades; he took bones from their bodies as tokens, swore to shield the survivors and from that moment sealed his emotions.

sub_claims.text: In a skirmish at a British outpost, friendly fire killed several of his comrades.
He took bones from their bodies as tokens.
He swore to shield the survivors.
From that moment, he sealed his emotions.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character Kai-Koumou does not take bones from his comrades as tokens and does not swear to shield the survivors after a skirmish at a British outpost.
